questions.question: I am waiting .......................... them.
questions.description: wait + for

questions.question: I don't think that he will agree .............................. our suggestion.
Whom does this bag belong ..............................?
We walked right ................................ the desert.
questions.description: Across is used to indicate movement in two dimensional spaces.

questions.question: She complained ………………………….. pain in her abdomen.
Dad was upset when I failed ........................... my test.
questions.description: fail + in

questions.question: I lent my bicycle ……………………………. him and never saw it again.
questions.description: lent + direct object + to + indirect object

questions.question: I haven't heard anything .............................. him.
He was robbed .............................. his belongings.
I can't agree ............................ this argument.
He is quite good .............................. drawing.
questions.description: We say good at.

questions.question: We have few reasons ............................... staying.
There is little point ................................. doing anything about it.
Can you send me the bill ................................... the repairs?
We live many miles ................................ the city.
Are you happy to work ................................... weekends?
I prefer you to call me .................................. my first name.
You shouldn't speak like that ................................ your grandparents.
For dinner I had leftovers .............................. lunch.
I think it is a good idea ....................................... him to find another job.
Arthritis is a common complaint ……………………….. the elderly.
Did she confide her plans …………………………. you?
Diplomas were conferred ………………………… members of the graduating class.
questions.description: confer + on

questions.question: The bank manager has complete confidence ……………………….. the tellers.
questions.description: confidence + in

questions.question: Please confine your remarks …………………………. the topic under discussion.
questions.description: confine + to

questions.question: I congratulate you ……………………………. your twentieth anniversary.
questions.description: congratulate + on

questions.question: You confused me …………………………… my twin brother.
Were you conscious …………………………… his hostility?
questions.description: conscious + of

questions.question: It was a bitter contest ………………………….. wills.
We must be prepared …………………………… any contingency.
questions.description: prepared + for

questions.question: Whether the picnic is held or not is dependent ………………………….. the weather.
Lying is contrary …………………………….. my beliefs.
questions.description: contrary + to

questions.question: Nobody knows the reason ……………………….. his death.
questions.description: reason + for

questions.question: What is wrong ………………………. you today? Why are you shouting at me?
questions.description: wrong + with

questions.question: I am thinking …………………………….. quitting.
questions.description: Either of or about can be used here.

questions.question: I have often thought ………………………… starting my own business.
questions.description: Either of or about can be used after think.

questions.question: Your grandmother reminds me ……………………….. my grandmother.
questions.description: remind + of

questions.question: I am sorry …………………………. interrupting you.
questions.description: Sorry can be used with for or about.

questions.question: I was surprised …………………………… the unexpected turn of events.
questions.description: Either by or at can be used after surprised.

questions.question: Hot weather is typical ……………………………. Chennai.
questions.description: typical + of

questions.question: Don’t throw stones ……………………………. the cat.
I took part …………………………. the quiz competition and won the second prize.
She suffers …………………………… cancer.
Could I speak …………………………… the manager?
When she arrived, I was listening .......................... some music.
I saw him getting ........................... the bus.
questions.description: People get on and off buses.

questions.question: I hear that the doctors are going .......................... strike.
questions.description: People go on strike.

questions.question: It gets ............................. my nerves to watch him acting so arrogantly.
This time tomorrow, I will be lying .................................... the beach.
She loves being looked ..............................
questions.description: look + at

questions.question: Having slept ................................ 8 hours, I felt refreshed.
questions.description: Use for to indicate duration.

questions.question: She can play almost every instrument you can think ...............................
Could you look ........................... the kids while I go shopping?
questions.description: To look after kids is to take care of them.

questions.question: You can't expect people to work ................................ no money.
She was frightened ............................ a mouse that ran into the room.
I usually visit my parents ……………………. Sundays.
questions.description: Use on before days.

questions.question: When I was a child, I had to walk two miles …………………………. school.
questions.description: To shows direction.

questions.question: She looked ………………………. the ceiling.
questions.description: Before an object we use look at.

questions.question: The girl smiled …………………………. me.
The meeting will start ………………………… three.
questions.description: Use at with clock times.

questions.question: Can I speak ………………………. the manager?
Tell him to leave ……………………… once.
You have to start coming ……………………… time.
questions.description: On time means neither late nor early.

questions.question: Have you written ………………………….. him?
‘Where is your umbrella? ‘I think I left it ……………………….. home.’
I have to go ……………………… a job interview tomorrow.
You can’t expect them to work hard ………………………… no money.
I enjoy watching movies ………………………. the cinema.
questions.description: At is used to indicate position at a point.

questions.question: He decided to quit his job …………………………. several reasons.
questions.description: For + reasons

questions.question: I like walking …………………………. the rain.
The meeting started exactly ……………………… time.
questions.description: On time means at the planned time.

questions.question: You look pretty ……………………… this photo.
……………………….. the end, she decided to marry her childhood friend.
The movie is not very interesting ………………………….. the end.
You never see things ………………………….. my point of view.
It will take longer if you go ……………………………. boat.
It is your dad …………………………… the phone.
Why are you angry ………………………… him?
She belongs ………………………… a literary club.
He has done a lot …………………………. me.
I have had a word …………………………… my boss.
We have known each other ……………………………. our school days.
I am spending the weekend …………………………….. my grandparents.
You have to start coming ………………………… time.
questions.description: To come on time is to be neither early nor late.

questions.question: Dogs must be kept ………………………… a lead.
Do you enjoy living …………………………… the mountains?
questions.description: The correct expression is in the hills / mountains.

questions.question: Do you mind if I look ……………………………… your paper?
The missing girl was found ………………………….. her friend’s house.
questions.description: At shows position at a point.

questions.question: I have heard ………………………………. him but we have never met each other.
……………………………….. having a headache, I enjoyed the picnic.
questions.description: You can use despite or in spite of here.

questions.question: She has been working here …………………………. July.
questions.description: Since indicates the starting point. It is common with the present perfect or present perfect continuous tense.

questions.question: Do not spend too much money ........................ personal care products.
questions.description: Spend + on

questions.question: As she narrated her story, her mother's eyes filled ............................ tears.
questions.description: Fill + with

questions.question: She often complains ............................... her nosy neighbours.
questions.description: Complain + about

questions.question: I am tired ............................... listening to your advice.
questions.description: Tired + of

questions.question: When she smiled .......................... me I became very happy.
questions.description: Smile + at

questions.question: They accused me ............................ gross negligence.
questions.description: Accuse + of

questions.question: I have benefitted immensely .............................. her help.
questions.description: Benefit + from

questions.question: The person who broke ............................. my house was a decent guy. He only stole my food.
questions.description: To break into is to enter forcibly.

questions.question: The coach is confident that he has prepared the players ............................. the match.
questions.description: Prepare + for

questions.question: She quit her job to devote more time .............................. her family.
Why don't you ever listen .............................. me?
questions.description: Listen + to

questions.question: I am sorry. I forgot .............................. your anniversary.
questions.description: Forget + about

questions.question: Lack ......................... money prevented her from going to university.
questions.description: Lack + of

questions.question: I couldn't choose ............................... the two dresses.
questions.description:
Choose + between
Among is used to talk about more than two people or things.

questions.question: There is huge demand ............................. caps of this kind.
questions.description: Demand + for

questions.question: After he became rich, his relationship ............................. his old friends changed a lot.
questions.description: Relationship + with

questions.question: The best solution ............................. many environmental problems is to use our resources wisely.
questions.description: Solution + to

questions.question: As the item was out of stock, there was a delay ................................ delivery.
questions.description: Delay + in

questions.question: She is an expert ....................................... child psychology.
questions.description: Expert + on

questions.question: I often quarrel ............................... my friends.
questions.description: Quarrel + with

questions.question: You are the reason ............................... my problems.
questions.description: Reason + for

questions.question: This law intends to protect animals .............................. cruelty.
questions.description: Protect + from

questions.question: She has no connection ............................... her family.
questions.description: Connection + with

questions.question: There are still millions of children who do not have access .................................. education.
questions.description: Access + to

questions.question: It would be a good idea to compare this year’s accounts ……………………………. last year’s.
………………………….. friends like you, who needs enemies?
questions.description: With can introduce the reason for a situation.

questions.question: Is he worth talking ………………………..?
Why are you talking ……………………… such a loud voice?
questions.description: We say in a …. voice.

questions.question: If you go ………………………. car, you will reach there in 2 hours.
Please write …………………….. ink.
I want to buy a computer ……………………….. a huge memory.
Catholics are supposed to go to church ……………………….. Sundays.
questions.description: We use on before names of days.

questions.question: I won’t take a penny …………………………. him.
Take that dirty hand ………………………… me.
He took some money …………………….. his wallet.
questions.description: Either from or out of is possible here.

questions.question: I have never had any interest ………………………. politics.
questions.description: We say interest in.

questions.question: I met him ……………………… Monday.
questions.description: We use on before days.

questions.question: They took him ……………………… the doctor.
questions.description: To indicates direction.

questions.question: Regular exercise is beneficial ……………………… health.
There are many disadvantages ………………………….. living alone.
The cat jumped ………………………… the wall.
She swam ………………………….. the river.
questions.description: Across indicates movement from one side to the other.

questions.question: You never listen ……………………….. me.
Why are you staring ………………………. me like that?
He is rude …………………………. everyone.
You can’t expect her to dance ………………………. your tune.
She recognized him ………………………. once.
He is enthusiastic …………………….. his profession.
I am looking …………………… my keys.
questions.description: To look for something is to search for it.

questions.question: I don’t agree …………………….. you.
questions.description: We agree with a person, opinion or policy.

questions.question: We cannot count …………………… him.
questions.description: To count on somebody is to trust them.

questions.question: He belongs …………………… a warrior clan.
They took him to hospital after he complained …………………… uneasiness.
questions.description: You complain of a problem.

questions.question: He is still dependent ………………………. his parents.
She is the eldest ……………………… the four siblings.
I was amazed ……………………… her performance.
She is quite good ……………………. solving puzzles.
questions.description: We say good at, bad at, poor at etc.

questions.question: The audience were enthralled ………………………. the spectacular performance of the children.
Why are you looking ………………………. me like that?
She didn't seem perturbed ............................... the commotion.
This painting is older ……………………. that.
How is this different …………………….. that?
questions.description: Different can be followed by from, to or than.

questions.question: Who is that boy …………………… the blue shirt?
I am waiting ……………………….. a call from my mother.
Suddenly it occurred ……………………. me that I hadn’t locked the door.
questions.description: If something occurs to you, you suddenly remember it.

questions.question: She insisted …………………….. my joining her.
He abstains ……………………… smoking and drinking.
You must refrain ……………………… binge eating.
Some rogues had set the house ………………………. fire.
I am thinking ……………………….. quitting my job.
His friends egged ……………………… him to run faster and faster.
questions.description: To egg on somebody is to encourage them.

questions.question: Nothing could stop him ……………………… pursuing his goal.
questions.description: Stop is followed by object + from.

questions.question: I am waiting …………………….. a call from my brother.
I don’t agree ………………………… your opinion.
You can never count ……………………… selfish people.
He belongs ………………………. a martial clan.
She is full ……………………… ambition.
A lot of people die …………………………. malaria.
They took him ………………………… the doctor.
I have made dinner ………………………….. you.
She got married ………………………….. her childhood friend.
Do you agree …………………………. the argument that smoking should be banned in public places?
questions.description: We agree with a view, opinion, argument or policy.

questions.question: She is quite good ………………………….. fooling people.
questions.description: We say good or bad at.

questions.question: Everyone praised the girl ……………………….. her honesty.
Don’t worry about the work. I will attend …………………. it tomorrow.
questions.description: To attend to work is to do it.

questions.question: Nobody paid any attention …………………….. the warning.
questions.description: People pay attention to something and shower attentions on people.

questions.question: The young man showered his attentions …………………… his fiancée.
questions.description: People pay attention to something and shower attentions on people.

questions.question: Your attendance ……………………. the club meeting is necessary.
The queen was always surrounded ………………………… her attendants.
Alexander Graham Bell astounded the world …………………….. his invention of the telephone.
The boy was so attached …………………… the new puppy that he refused to leave it.
questions.description: Attach is used with to.

questions.question: He was ashamed ………………………… his bad manners.
questions.description: Ashamed is used with of.

questions.question: The majority assented ……………………. my views on the matter.
questions.description: Assent is used with to.

questions.question: A locker was assigned ……………………….. each student.
She was anxious ………………………. her mother’s illness.
Someday his antisocial behavior will land him ……………………… jail.
Don’t make a such a bother ………………….. which dress to wear.
questions.description: When bother is a noun, it can be used with over or about.

questions.question: The ship sank ……………………. the bottom.
questions.description: In and at shows position. To indicates ideas such as movement and direction.

questions.question: She spanked the boy ………………………. his bottom.
questions.description: On indicates position on the surface.

questions.question: In olden days the poor had to depend ……………………. the parish’s bounty.
questions.description: Depend is used with on.

questions.question: He was punished ………………………. a boyish prank.
questions.description: For shows the purpose or the reason.

questions.question: The typist botched the work and had to start ……………………..
questions.description: To start over is to do it again.

questions.question: The guest speaker turned ………………………….. to be a deadly bore.
questions.description: Turn out means prove to be the case.

questions.question: The policemen showed great bravery …………………………. the face of danger.
We were stunned …………………………. the breadth of the mountain range.
Mosquitoes breed ……………………….. stagnant water.
A storm is brewing ……………………….. the horizon.
Her bridal gown was ……………………….. pure silk.
questions.description: Of shows the material with which something is made.

questions.question: I look forward to ………………. my grandchildren.
questions.description: When to is used as a preposition, it is followed by an ing form.

questions.question: They accused him …………………… poisoning their dog.
questions.description: We accuse somebody of something.

questions.question: I totally disagree …………………….. you.
questions.description: We agree with a person.

questions.question: I cannot agree ……………………… the argument that a ban on smoking violates individual rights.
questions.description: We agree with an opinion or argument.

questions.question: I must apologize …………………….. my rude conduct.
questions.description: We apologize for something.

questions.question: They will take you back if you apologize ……………………….. them.
Do you believe ………………………… ghosts?
The loud noise from the street prevented me ……………………… sleeping.
questions.description: Prevent is followed by from + ing form.

questions.question: I was quite impressed …………………… her performance.
You don’t have to pay …………………… that drink.
Once he found a good job, he got married …………………….. his childhood sweetheart.
questions.description: Marriage is used with the preposition to.

questions.question: Do you know the reason ……………………… his unhappiness.
questions.description: Reason is followed by for.

questions.question: There are four stages …………….. the metamorphosis of a mosquito.
I can’t find anything ……………………. this messy desk.
questions.description: On indicates position on the surface of something.

questions.question: Trying to define God led us ………………….. even more metaphysical questions.
questions.description: Led is used with to.

questions.question: He was praised ……………………… his meritorious service.
The caretaker showed no mercy ……………………. trespassers.
Dickens was a great writer ……………………….. his tearful plots.
questions.description: Although is a conjunction despite is used alone without of.

questions.question: The car was going ………………………. its maximum speed.
…………………….. the two examples, I prefer the latter.
questions.description: Of is the correct word here.

questions.question: The clown made the children laugh ………………………… joy.
questions.description: With is used in a number of expressions which say how people are showing their emotions.

questions.question: The comedian finally got a laugh ………………………… the unresponsive audience.
You will be a laughingstock …………………….. that silly outfit.
questions.description: We use in to say what people are wearing.

questions.question: I wish I had her knack ……………………… cooking.
questions.description: Knack is used with for.

questions.question: The child ran ……………………….. the road.
questions.description: To run across a road is to move from one side to the other side.

questions.question: The news from …………………………. the borders is quite disquieting.
questions.description: Across and over can mean on or to the other side of a line, river, road etc.

questions.question: I got up early ………………………….. the morning.
questions.description: We use in with parts of the day.

questions.question: She arrived ………………………….. Monday.
questions.description: Before days we use on.

questions.question: I can run 4 miles ……………………… a stretch.
questions.description: At a stretch means in one continuous period.

questions.question: We usually go swimming ………………………… the weekend.
questions.description: Either on or at can be used here.

questions.question: The hall can seat ………………………… 700 people.
questions.description: To talk about quantity we use up to.

questions.question: The meeting has been postponed ………………………… Friday.
questions.description: Either till or until can be used here.

questions.question: There is a restaurant ………………………….. the road.
questions.description: Sometimes both up and down can mean along.

questions.question: The meeting must start …………………………….. time.
questions.description: On time means at the planned time.

questions.question: I haven’t seen him …………………………. Monday.
questions.description: Since is used with the starting point.

questions.question: I will be here ……………………….. two weeks.
He accused me …………………….. stealing his money.
questions.description: We accuse somebody of something

questions.question: I am afraid ………………………… spiders.
Do you agree …………………………… his decision to quit?
questions.description: You agree with a person, opinion or policy.

questions.question: We agree …………………………. most things.
questions.description: We agree about a subject of discussion.

questions.question: I don’t know why he is angry ………………………….. me?
I am anxious ……………………………. my exam.
We are all anxious ………………………….. an end to this conflict.
questions.description: Anxious for means eager to have.

questions.question: They apologized …………………………… the old lady.
questions.description: Apologize to somebody for something

questions.question: We arrived …………………………….. New York in the afternoon.
She is quite good …………………………… mind reading.
questions.description: We say good at or bad at.

questions.question: I don’t believe …………………………. ghosts or fairies.
Those vases belong ………………………………. that shelf.
I look forward to ……………………. from you.
questions.description: When to is used as a preposition, it is followed by an ing form.

questions.question: She accused me ………………………. reading her letters.
questions.description: We accuse somebody of something.

questions.question: I completely agree ………………………….. you.
questions.description: We agree with a person.

questions.question: I do not agree ………………………… the argument that zoos protect animals.
questions.description: We agree with an opinion or argument.

questions.question: I must apologize …………………………. offending you.
questions.description: We apologize for something.

questions.question: I think you should apologize ………………………… him.
questions.description: We apologize to somebody for something.

questions.question: Do you believe ………………………… life after death?
The headache prevented me …………………………… studying.
questions.description: Prevent is followed by object + from + ing form.

questions.question: I am quite pleased ……………………….. my performance.
I was hoping that she would pay …………………………. my drink but she didn’t.
Her marriage ……………………….. her childhood sweetheart did not last long.
questions.description: Marriage is used with the preposition to.

questions.question: Nobody knows the reason ………………………… his untimely death.
questions.description: We use for with reason and of with cause.

questions.question: She was deaf …………………… our repeated pleas for help.
questions.description: We say deaf to.

questions.question: Regular exercise is beneficial ………………………. health.
questions.description: We say beneficial to.

questions.question: My birthday coincides ……………………….. my wedding anniversary.
The drop in the stock market was coincidental …………………………. the bad news from abroad.
The new employee must be good ………………………. filing.
questions.description: We say good at, bad at, clever at etc.

questions.question: The house served as collateral ……………………………. the loan.
We sailed ………………………….. the entire circumference of the island.
Be circumspect ……………………….. making important decisions.
Even though angry, he treated us ……………………… civility.
The worker left the job ………………………… his own.
Are you conscious …………………………. your rights and responsibilities?
questions.description: We say conscious of.

questions.question: We regret that we cannot comply …………………………….. your request.
A year in India initiated him …………………….. the world of spirituality.
questions.description: Something initiatives somebody into something.

questions.question: The hostess tried to inject some life ……………………………. the party.
Poor management is injurious …………………………. a business.
questions.description: Injurious takes the preposition to before an object.

questions.question: The harsh review was an injury …………………………… the actor’s pride.
Mozart had an innate genius ………………………… music.
She confided her innermost thoughts ………………………….. me.
The pilot inquired …………………………….. the weather conditions.
questions.description: To inquire about something is to seek information about it.

questions.question: The reporter inquired ……………………………. the rumors of fraud.
questions.description: To inquire into something is to investigate.

questions.question: The letter made her insane ……………………….. jealousy.
questions.description: With is used in a number of expressions which say how people show their emotions and sensations.

questions.question: He was always insensitive ………………………………. the feelings of others.
He inserted the key …………………………. the lock.
The teacher had unusual insight ………………………….. children’s emotions.
She is suffering ………………………. cancer.
questions.description: We say suffer from.

questions.question: Try to be nice ………………………… my guests.
questions.description: We say nice to.

questions.question: She is married ………………………… her childhood sweetheart.
questions.description: We say be/get married to.

questions.question: The doctors operated …………………………. her yesterday.
So far we have not got any proof …………………………. the existence of life on other planets.
questions.description: We say proof of.

questions.question: She is rude …………………………… everyone.
questions.description: We say rude to.

questions.question: You should try to be polite ………………………… your subordinates.
I ran ……………………….. your dad at Victoria Terminus yesterday.
questions.description: To run into somebody is to meet them.

questions.question: The police are searching …………………………. the dacoits.
questions.description: Search for means look for.

questions.question: Why are you shouting ………………………… me?
I feel really sorry ………………………….. him.
questions.description: We feel sorry for a person.

questions.question: I am sorry ………………………….. your loss.
questions.description: We feel sorry about something that has happened.

questions.question: They swam ………………….. the river.
questions.description: We usually prefer across to talk about movement in water.

questions.question: They live in a village just ………………………… the border.
questions.description: Across and over can mean on or to the other side of a line, river, road etc.

questions.question: I work best ……………………….. the evening.
questions.description: We use in with parts of the day.

questions.question: See you …………………….. Saturday evening.
questions.description: Before days we use on.

questions.question: I can run 400 meters ………………………. about one minute.
We usually go and see grandmother …………………………. Sunday.
That car can seat ……………………….. seven people.
questions.description: To talk about quantity we use up to.

questions.question: I won’t be seeing him ………………………. Wednesday.
questions.description: Not until can mean the same as not before.

questions.question: The nearest restaurant is about half a mile ………………………….. the road.
questions.description: Sometimes both up and down can mean along.

questions.question: None of the last six trains has been ………………………….. time.
questions.description: On time means at the planned time.

questions.question: He could have been saved if they had brought him to hospital ………………………….. time.
questions.description: In time means before the last moment.

questions.question: I have been here …………………………. three weeks now.
He met his future wife ……………………… a party.
questions.description: We use at in the expressions at a party, at the cinema, at the theatre, at university etc.

questions.question: They were friends ………………………. university.
questions.description: We use at in the expressions at a party, at the cinema, at the theatre, at university etc.

questions.question: Let’s take our time and go …………………. boat.
questions.description: We use by in expressions like by car, by bus, by bike, by boat, by plane etc.

questions.question: She goes to school ……………………….. foot.
She decided to quit her job ………………………. several reasons.
questions.description: We use for with reason.

questions.question: You never see things ………………………… my point of view.
questions.description: We use from with point of view.

questions.question: …………………….. my opinion, she shouldn’t have married him.
……………………… the end, I have found a good job.
questions.description: In the end means finally.

questions.question: I am paid ……………………….. the end of the month.
questions.description: At the end means at the point where something ends.

questions.question: You look quite pretty …………………………. this photo.
The meeting started ……………………. time.
questions.description: On time means at the planned time.

questions.question: He was deaf ………………………………. our pleas for help.
questions.description: Deaf is followed by to.

questions.question: Physical activity is beneficial …………………………… health.
questions.description: We say beneficial to something or somebody.

questions.question: Are you conscious ……………………………….. your rights and responsibilities?
She refused to comply …………………………………. my request.
questions.description: We say comply with.

questions.question: The honor was conferred ………………………………. him at the convocation.
He congratulated me ………………………………. my new job.
questions.description: Congratulate can be followed by on or for.

questions.question: He is thoroughly conversant ……………………………… the problem.
questions.description: Conversant is followed by with.

questions.question: The manager called ………………………………… an explanation from the cashier.
I don’t care ……………………………… your opinion. If I want to do something, I will do it.
questions.description: To care about something is to think that it is important.

questions.question: He fell …………………………….. suspicion.
questions.description: When you fall under something, you become affected by it.

questions.question: The inspector has promised to inquire …………………………………. the complaint.
questions.description: To inquire into is the look into or probe.

questions.question: He inquired …………………………….. homes for sale.
questions.description: To inquire about is to ask about.

questions.question: I look forward to ……………………………….. from you.
questions.description: When to is a preposition, it is followed by an ing form.

questions.question: It is Janet ……………………………… the phone. She wants to talk to you.
questions.description: We say on the phone.

questions.question: Is there anything interesting …………………………….. the radio tonight?
questions.description: We say on the radio.

questions.question: He met his future bride ……………………………. a party.
questions.description: At is used in some common fixed expressions like at a party, at the club, at the theatre etc.

questions.question: …………………………………. the end, I got a visa for the UK.
questions.description: In the end means after a long time.

questions.question: The movie is not very interesting ……………………………. the end.
questions.description: At the end means at the point where something stops.

questions.question: You look prettier ………………………………. this photo.
questions.description: We say in a picture or in a photo.

questions.question: Can you find a bird …………………………….. that picture?
There is no room ………………………………. the bus.
questions.description: We say ‘on a bus’.

questions.question: The boys looked dapper …………………………….. their uniforms.
questions.description: We say in a shirt, suit, hat, coat, uniform etc.

questions.question: The meeting started ………………………………. time.
questions.description: On time means at the planned time.

questions.question: Why are you talking ………………………………. such a loud voice?
Who will ……………………………… the drinks?
questions.description: We pay for something that is bought.

questions.question: He wasn’t very nice ……………………………. me when we met yesterday.
questions.description: With is not used after words which say how people act towards others.

questions.question: The noise prevented me …………………………….
questions.description: Prevent is followed by object + from + ing form.

questions.question: He is rude ……………………………… everyone.
questions.description: With is not used after words which say how people act towards others.

questions.question: The police ………………………………….. everybody’s luggage.
questions.description: When search is used without preposition, it means look through.

questions.question: The police are ………………………………. a bald guy in his thirties.
questions.description: Search for means the same as look for.

questions.question: I was shocked ………………………………… the news of the accident.
questions.description: Either by or at can be used after shocked.

questions.question: He is quite pleased …………………………………. his results.
I am thinking ………………………………… studying palmistry.
questions.description: Either about or of is possible here. To is not possible.

questions.question: He is polite ………………………………. everyone.
What does it mean if you dream …………………………………… hills and valleys?
The driver was sleeping and crashed …………………………………. the car in front.
questions.description: We usually say crash into.

questions.question: I was amazed ……………………….. their brilliant performance.
questions.description: Amaze is followed by the preposition at.

questions.question: He is afflicted ………………………. leprosy.
questions.description: Afflict is followed by with.

questions.question: Alcohol does not agree ………………………….. me.
You must apologize ………………………… your bad behavior.
questions.description: We write for after apologize.

questions.question: She often boasts ………………………….. her success.
One must not brood ………………………. one’s failures.
questions.description: Brood is followed by over.

questions.question: We called …………………………… them yesterday.
questions.description: To call on is to visit.

questions.question: He has been charged …………………………… treason.
I do not want to compete …………………….. anybody.
The merchant deals …………………………. precious metals.
questions.description: Deal in can mean sell.

questions.question: One must not deviate …………………………. the path of truth and virtue.
questions.description: Deviate is followed by from.

questions.question: He has never shown any interest …………………….. politics.
The killer smothered the victim ……………………… a pillow.
questions.description: We use with to refer to the instrument used by somebody.

questions.question: You have an ink smudge ……………………….. your shirt.
questions.description: We use on to indicate position on the surface of something.

questions.question: She snapped ……………………….. me when I tried to comfort her.
questions.description: The words snapped, yelled, shouted etc., are followed by at.

questions.question: The professor was sparing ………………………… his praise.
He demonstrated a staunch belief …………………………… human rights.
questions.description: Belief is followed by in.

questions.question: My feet ached …………………………… the two-hour stand.
questions.description: From can indicate the cause.

questions.question: He stormed …………………………… the waiter and embarrassed everyone at the table.
questions.description: We use at after some verbs to indicate the target.

questions.question: I can’t believe you would stoop ……………………….. such nonsense.
He struck me ………………………….. his fist.
questions.description: We use with to refer to the instrument used by somebody.

questions.question: She stretched the clothesline …………………………. two trees.
questions.description: Use between to speak of two things.

questions.question: The region has long been stricken ……………………………. poverty.
All hands were rescued ………………………….. the stricken ship.
We commenced work ………………… Monday.
questions.description: From indicates some point of time. It is used with all tenses.

questions.question: He sat …………………….. a chair.
questions.description: We use on to speak of things at rest.

questions.question: I slept ……………………… 11 o’clock.
questions.description: We use till to indicate time. We use up to to indicate distance or quantity.

questions.question: I have not eaten anything ……………………… yesterday.
questions.description: Since denotes some point of time in the past. It is used with a perfect tense.

questions.question: We walked …………………………. the end of the street.
questions.description: We use up to to talk about distance.

questions.question: An old feud existed ………………………. the two families.
questions.description: We use between to speak of two people or things.

questions.question: The caravan must reach its destination …………………………… sunset.
questions.description: We use before to indicate time we use in front of to indicate position.

questions.question: I will return ……………………….. an hour.
questions.description: We use in before a noun denoting a period of time

questions.question: I must start …………………….. dawn.
I have been waiting for this moment …………………….. years.
questions.description: We use for to indicate duration.

questions.question: He is …………………… the top of the class.
That is the boy I was speaking ……………………..
I met him ......................... a club.
questions.description: We use at to indicate position at a point.

questions.question: There is some water ......................... the bottle.
questions.description: We use in to indicate position inside something.

questions.question: The car broke down .......................... the way to work.
I read an interesting article ........................ the magazine.
questions.description: We say in a book or a magazine.

questions.question: She spent the whole day ............................. the bedroom.
If you are hungry, there is a banana ............................. the fridge.
They are moving .............................. the suburbs.
questions.description: We use to to indicate direction.

questions.question: Could you take the children .............................. school?
You can call me ................................ six.
questions.description: We use at with clock time.

questions.question: The Prime Minister spoke ............................ television last night.
questions.description: We use on with television.

questions.question: Can you recognize him ............................... this photo?
Bangalore is ............................... the South of India.
This is the book ……………………
questions.description: When the object of the preposition is the relative pronoun that, the preposition is always placed at the end.

questions.question: He is …………………… the top of his class.
questions.description: We use at to speak of things at rest.

questions.question: The snake crawled ………………… its hole.
questions.description: We use into to speak of things in motion.

questions.question: This is the house ……………………
The cat sprang …………………. the table.
questions.description: We use upon to speak of things in motion.

questions.question: We walked …………………… the end of the street.
questions.description: Until and till are used to talk about time to talk about distance we use to or up to.

questions.question: I slept …………………. 9 o’clock.
questions.description: We use till to talk about time.

questions.question: I haven’t eaten anything …………………. yesterday.
questions.description: Since is used to indicate some point of time in the past.

questions.question: He has been ill …………………… many days.
questions.description: For is used with a period of time.

questions.question: I have not seen him …………………. last week.
questions.description: Since is used to indicate some point of time in the past.

questions.question: He will join work ……………………. tomorrow.
questions.description: From is also used with a noun or phrase indicating a point of time, but unlike since it is used with all the tenses.

questions.question: …………………….. his children, his nephews and nieces were present there.
questions.description: Besides means in addition to.

questions.question: It is too late to go out now. …………………., it’s starting to rain.
questions.description: Besides and in addition can mean also.

questions.question: There were ………………… ten people at the meeting.
questions.description: Under means less than or younger than.

questions.question: She is well ……………………… average in intelligence.
questions.description: Above is used in cases where we think of a vertical scale.

questions.question: We lost the championship …………………………. working very hard.
questions.description: In spite is a preposition. Although and however are conjunctions.

questions.question: We understood him ……………………… his strange accent.
questions.description: Despite can be used in the same way as in spite of. It is more formal.

questions.question: I could not enjoy the movie ……………………….. the headache.
questions.description: Because of is the opposite of in spite of.

questions.question: The cat is ……………………. the roof again.
questions.description: We use on to talk about the positions of things.

questions.question: How did that cat get ……………………… the roof?
questions.description: We use onto to talk about directions and destinations.

questions.question: Can you translate this letter …………………… German?
questions.description: We normally use into after verbs suggesting change.

questions.question: I prefer swimming ……………………. walking.
questions.description: Prefer is followed by to.

questions.question: Can you go with Madhu ………………………… me today?
questions.description: Instead of is the preposition. Instead without of is an adverb.

questions.question: Wine can be made …………………….. blackberries.
questions.description: We use make from to talk about changing a material into a completely different form to make something.

questions.question: You must abide ……………………. the laws.
questions.description: Abide is followed by ‘by’.

questions.question: This pond abounds ………………….. fish.
questions.description: Abound can be followed by in/with.

questions.question: I didn’t see him because I was absorbed …………………. my work.
questions.description: If you are absorbed in something, its holds your attention of.

questions.question: We tried our best to accommodate …………………….. their needs.
questions.description: There is no preposition after accommodate

questions.question: Money was …………………… no account to them.
questions.description: If something is of no account to you, it is not important for you.

questions.question: He was accused ……………………… murdering his landlord.
questions.description: Accused is followed by of.

questions.question: All members must adhere …………………… a code of conduct.
questions.description: Adhere is followed by to.

questions.question: His body language did not agree ………………… what he was saying.
questions.description: Agree with means be consistent with.

questions.question: The manager did not agree …………………… my leaving early.
questions.description: To agree to something is to consent to it.

questions.question: It was a lifestyle that was completely alien ………………….. me.
questions.description: If something is alien to you, it is not acceptable to you.

questions.question: Would you mind if I brought ……………………. a few friends?
questions.description: To bring along a few friends is to bring them with you.

questions.question: I had lost my appetite …………………… study.
questions.description: Appetite for means a liking.

questions.question: This table is made ……………………….. teak wood.
questions.description: We say make of when we identify the material used to make something.

questions.question: I am going …………………….
questions.description: No preposition is used before home when we are referring to direction.

questions.question: He hit me ……………………….. a stick.
questions.description: We use ‘with’ to talk about the tool and 'by' to talk about the agent.

questions.question: India has been independent …………………………
questions.description: With perfect tenses we use since, not from.

questions.question: He wrote ………………………….
questions.description: Before a personal object, we use ‘write to’.

questions.question: Divide this money ……………………………. the brothers.
questions.description: We can use divide among or divide between before a plural noun.

questions.question: He invited me ………………………. dinner.
We ……………………….. Delhi in the morning.
questions.description: We do not use a preposition after reach.

questions.question: This is a common practice ………………………. the Hindus.
questions.description: Between is used with two or more clearly separate people or things. Among is used for a crowd or a mass of people.

questions.question: This is a good house to ……………………….
This is the road to ………………………..
I gave him a chair to ………………………..
She went to school ……………….. Frankfurt.
questions.description: After expressions like go to school, we use in. Sometimes at is also possible.

questions.question: We arrived ………………………… Shanghai on Monday morning.
questions.description: After arrive we use in or at.

questions.question: Due to his extravagant lifestyle, he landed himself ………………………….. deep trouble.
questions.description: We use in / at after land.

questions.question: I broke the stick ………………………..
questions.description: In half is the correct expression here.

questions.question: She cut the vegetables ………………………… small pieces.
questions.description: Cut can be followed by in or into.

questions.question: She threw another log …………………… the fire.
She performed well …………………………. having a headache.
questions.description: In spite of is a preposition. We need a preposition before a noun or ing form.

questions.question: He threw the ball ………………………. the window.
questions.description: Out of is the opposite of into. Out without of is possible in an informal style.

questions.question: Don’t marry him. Marry me ………………………..
questions.description: Instead without of is an adverb. It usually goes at the beginning or at the end of a clause.

questions.question: He watched TV all day …………………….. going to work.
questions.description: Instead of is a preposition. It can be followed by a noun or an ing form. Without is not used with this meaning.

questions.question: He tripped ……………………….. the cat and fell downstairs.
questions.description: The verb tripped is followed by the preposition over.

questions.question: I am sorry ………………………… breaking your window.
questions.description: Sorry can be followed by for or about.

questions.question: The snake crawled ………………… its hole.
questions.description: Into is used in speaking of things in motion.

questions.question: The boys jumped ………………… the river.
questions.description: Into is used in speaking of things in motion.

questions.question: The cat sprang …………………… the table.
questions.description: On is used in speaking of things at rest, and upon is used in speaking of things in motion.

questions.question: He sat ……………………. a bench.
questions.description: On indicates position on the surface of something.

questions.question: We walked …………………… the end of the street.
questions.description: Until is only used to talk about time. To talk about distance, we use up to or as far as.

questions.question: You can earn ………………… 500 dollars a week in this job.
questions.description: Up to is also used to talk about quantity.

questions.question: He killed two birds …………………. one shot.
questions.description: With denotes the instrument and by denotes the agent.

questions.question: The traveler was stabbed ……………………. a lunatic.
questions.description: With denotes the instrument and by denotes the agent.

questions.question: I have done nothing ………………………. morning.
questions.description: Since indicates the starting point of an action. It is usually preceded by a perfect or perfect continuous tense.

questions.question: They will join school …………………… tomorrow.
questions.description: From also indicates the starting point. However, it is mainly used with simple tenses. It can also refer to the future.

questions.question: Human sacrifices were practiced ……………………… the Nagas.
questions.description: By denotes the agent - the person(s) or thing(s) that commit(s) the action.

questions.question: ……………………. his children, there were present his nephews and nieces.
questions.description: Beside means by the side of besides means in addition to.

questions.question: We walked ……………………… the edge of the desert.
questions.description: To talk about distance, we can use ‘up to’ or ‘as far as’.

questions.question: It is another three weeks ............................... the holidays.
questions.description: We can use ‘to’ when counting the time until a future event. Until is also possible here.

questions.question: I don’t know how she manages to support such a large family. She has nothing ................................... her pension.
questions.description: After negative expressions like ‘no’, ‘nobody’ and ‘nothing’, all of these three expressions can have the same meaning.

questions.question: Are you wearing anything ………………………. your sweater?
questions.description: ‘Underneath’ can be used as a preposition instead of ‘under’. But note that ‘underneath’ can only show position. ‘Under’, on the other hand, can also mean ‘lower than’.

questions.question: Do you mind? I was ……………………………. you!
questions.description: ‘Before’ is possible here. ‘Before’ can be used to talk about the order in which people or things come in lists, queues, etc. ‘In front of’ is also correct here. It shows position.

questions.question: We should arrive ……………………… their place ……………………. time …………………… lunch.
questions.description: ‘Arrive’ is followed by ‘at’ or ‘in’. ‘In time’ means ‘before the planned time’. The option ‘for’ is also correctly used.

questions.question: They live ………………………. a small one bedroom flat ………………….. the third floor.
questions.description: ‘In’ shows position inside something. We use ‘on’ for the number of the floor.

questions.question: Granny is arriving ………………………. the 30 train.
questions.description: We use ‘on’ and ‘off’ to talk about travel using public transport (buses, planes, trains, etc).

questions.question: Last year, there were a large number of mangoes ……………………. the tree.
questions.description: ‘On’ can mean ‘attached to’. The mangoes are attached to the tree.

questions.question: His house is ……………………….. the way from Mumbai to Thane.
questions.description: To indicate position on a line (for example a road or a river), we use ‘on’.

questions.question: He met and fell in love with a French girl when he was ………………………. the London School of Economics.
questions.description: ‘At’ is used to say where people study.

questions.question: A few days after the accident she died ……………………….. the injuries.
questions.description: We say ‘die of’ or ‘die from’.

questions.question: Who is this present ………….?
I am really angry ……………. you.
questions.description: With is used after a number of adjectives which say how people are feeling towards others.

questions.question: …………… all this work to do, I won’t have time to take a holiday.
questions.description: With can introduce the accompanying circumstances.

questions.question: He was talking ……………. such a low voice that I could not hear anything.
questions.description: We say ‘in a voice’.

questions.question: If we go …………… car, we will reach there before sunset.
questions.description: We use 'by' with car, train, bus etc.

questions.question: The actress has always been very nice ……………. her fans.
questions.description: Words like kind, nice, polite and rude are followed by to.

questions.question: …………….friends like you, who needs enemies?
questions.description: With can mean 'because there are/is.'

questions.question: What kind of movies are you interested …………..?
questions.description: We say 'interested in something'.

questions.question: The cottage is pleasant to live …………….
questions.description: We 'live in' a cottage or a house.

questions.question: Which flight is she travelling ……………?
questions.description: People travel 'on a flight'

questions.question: You are the only woman I have ever been in love…………………
That is what I am afraid ……………..
questions.description: We say 'afraid of something'.

questions.question: There are many villages ................... the border.
questions.description: Across and over can both mean on or to the other side of a road, river or bridge.

questions.question: ......................... thousand people participated in the program.
questions.description: Over can mean 'more than'.

questions.question: The boy jumped ...................... the stream.
questions.description: Across and over can both mean on or to the other side of a road, river or bridge.

questions.question: She was silent all ........................ the journey.
questions.description: We use through to talk about periods or activities.

questions.question: Could you pass these leaflets .....................?
questions.description: Round can be used to talk about distribution.

questions.question: 'Where is John?' 'He must be somewhere .........................'
questions.description: Around and about can both be used to indicate indefinite movement and position.

questions.question: He spends much of his time doing odd jobs ....................... the house.
There were ......................... twenty people at the lecture.
questions.description: Under can mean less than

questions.question: There is something ........................ the bed.
questions.description: Underneath can be used instead of under to refer to physical position.

questions.question: The house is too small. ........................... it requires a lot of repairs.
questions.description: Besides means in addition to.

questions.question: I like all musical instruments ...................... the piano.
He shared the food ........................ his wife, son and daughter.
questions.description: Before a series of singular nouns, we use share between.

questions.question: Could you translate this document .............. German for me?
questions.description: Translate is followed by into, not in or to.

questions.question: You remind me ................... my cousin.
questions.description: Remind is followed by of.

questions.question: He wasn't very nice ....................... me when we met last week.
questions.description: To talk about people's attitude, we use nice to.

questions.question: This perfume is typical ...................... the region.
questions.description: After typical we use of, not for.

questions.question: Her marriage ..................... James didn't last very long.
questions.description: Marriage is followed by to. Also, we get married to somebody.

questions.question: He married .................. childhood sweetheart.
questions.description: You marry somebody. No preposition is used in this expression.

questions.question: I will ............................. the drinks.
questions.description: We pay somebody and pay for something.

questions.question: Everybody was surprised ..................... the weather.
questions.description: Surprise can be followed by 'at' or 'by'.

questions.question: I tripped ......................... the  bags and fell on the platform.
The customs are searching .................... drugs at the airport.
questions.description: To search for something is to look for it.

questions.question: We had a ........................ philosophy.
questions.description: Discussion is followed by about.

questions.question: We have just entered .................... an agreement with them.
I was waiting ......................... the bus stop when I met Larry.
questions.description: We use at to talk about position at a place.

questions.question: Is there any milk .............................. the bottle?
questions.description: In is used for position inside three-dimensional spaces.

questions.question: I was .......................... my way to work when I met with an accident.
questions.description: On the way means during the journey.

questions.question: Please don't stand in the door - you are .......................... my way.
questions.description: In the / my way is used for obstacles.

questions.question: There is no way ............................ proving that he was lying.
She has acted ............................ several movies.
questions.description: The correct expression is 'act in movies'.

questions.question: Have you put the meat ........................ the fridge?
I haven't seen her after she moved ......................... Canada.
questions.description: We use 'to' to indicate direction.

questions.question: Can you put the child .......................... bed?
questions.description: To put someone to bed is to make them go to bed.

questions.question: The President will appear ........................ television tonight.
questions.description: The correct expressions are on the radio, on television and on the phone.

questions.question: We want the meeting to start exactly ......................... time.
questions.description: If something happens on time, it happens at the planned time.

questions.question: She decided to quit her job ........................ several reasons.
questions.description: We use 'for' before reason.

questions.question: I slept ........................... nine o'clock.
questions.description: Till and until mean the same. Till is used of time, and to is used of place.

questions.question: I commenced work ......................... 1st May.
questions.description: Like since, from can be used to denote the starting point however, unlike since, from is used with all the tenses.

questions.question: We walked ........................ the end of the street.
questions.description: Till is not used of place. It indicates time.

questions.question: The child has been missing ............................ yesterday.
questions.description: With perfect and perfect continuous tenses, we prefer since and for. Since shows the starting point of something.

questions.question: He traveled seventy miles ......................... two hours.
questions.description: When 'in' is used before a noun indicating a period of time, it means 'at the end of'.

questions.question: I received this message ....................... 7 o'clock .................. the morning.
questions.description: We use 'at' before clock times and 'in' before morning and evening.

questions.question: I saw him felling a big tree .................... a hatchet.
questions.description: With denotes the instrument and by denotes the agent.

questions.question: An old feud existed ................... the two families.
questions.description: We use between to speak of two people or things we use among to speak of a group of people or things.

questions.question: ......................... Peter and John, there were three other boys present.
questions.description: Beside means by the side of besides means in addition to.

questions.question: He was stabbed .................... a lunatic ................ a dagger.
questions.description: With denotes the instrument and by denotes the agent.

questions.question: She dislikes being looked .........................
questions.description: Words like look, stare, shout etc., take the preposition at.

questions.question: Don't throw food ...................... the dog.
questions.description: Throw at indicates an idea of attack. Throw to is used when there is no idea of attack.

questions.question: Manchester is known ……………….. its textile industry.
The goat subsists ………………… leaves.
She is quite fond ………………. her grandchildren.
It is natural for men to wish ………………. distinction.
It is evident that he is enamored ………………… her.
Ambition does not always conduce ………………. happiness.
Nowadays computers are cheap enough to be accessible ………………… most people.
A gentleman is courteous ……………… his neighbors.
I am indebted ………………. you for your help.
People who are averse ……………….. hard work do not succeed in life.
There is no cure ………………. the common cold.
The noise from upstairs prevented me ………………… sleeping.
Thomas Alva Edison is one ………………….. the most famous inventors who ever lived.
Edison, who is known as the Magician ………………. Menlo Park, accomplished many successes …………….. his life.
He has 1093 patents ……………….. telegraphy, photography and electric lighting.
Some ……………… his inventions were original.
Some others were improvements of things invented …………….. others.
Edison also established a factory ……………… invent things.
Thomas Alva Edison was born ……………… Ohio ..................... February 11,
He died ……………… October 18, 1931 …………….. New Jersey.
He was the seventh and last child …………….. his parents who had no special background.
Edison started school …………….. seven.
After three months his mother pulled him …………. school and started teaching him herself ………….. home.
His parents encouraged him to learn things .................. his own.
They never die who die …………………. a noble cause.
The judge has acquitted him ………………. murder.
Did he prevent you ..................... coming here?
These seats are reserved ...................... candidates belonging ..................... backward classes.
She takes pride …………………. her children.
Do not cry …………………. spilt milk.
He is well-versed ...................... English.
He is notorious ....................... his evil deeds.
The leader is very popular ..................... . his countrymen.
Cholera has broken …………………. in the village.
We need a trainer to break ……………….. our pony.
Please send James ……………….. the doctor. This is an emergency.
He was so ill that a doctor had to be called ......................
I am tired ...................... his company.
The dog was beaten ………………….. a stick.
She was trembling ....................... fear.
I received a letter ....................... my mother.
My friend has invited me ………………….. his party.
I live ………………… my parents.
He discussed the problem …………………. his brothers.
He drew a picture ....................... the pencil.
My house is ..................... the river.
He comes …………………. Chennai.
This train runs ..................... Delhi and Agra.
She sat ………………… the children.
There is no unity ..................... .. the brothers.
We cancelled the trip ..................... the rain.
He played well ...................... the injury.
He is not fit ——————- this job.
She flew ———————- a rage when she heard the news.
She is very fond ——————– her grandchildren.
Don’t be forgetful ———————- your duties.
The laboratory is furnished ——————- all necessary equipment.
I can’t get ——————– this nasty cough.
I am grateful ——————– you for your help.
Why are you always grumbling ——————— something or other?
He was found guilty ———————– gross impropriety.
I handed it ——————- to its owner.
He was always hankering ——————– wealth and power.
Don’t be so hard ———————– your servants.
He is the heir ———————- the estate.
I have nothing to hide ——————- you.
The criminals hit ——————– a plan to escape from the prison.
You must abide …………………. the terms of this agreement.
This part of the country abounds ....................... rare metals.
He has been absent .....................… the class for two weeks now.
He was absorbed ....................... his work.
You must abstain ...................... smoking and drinking.
We cannot accede .....................… this request.
This suggestion is not acceptable ………………….. me.
Millions of people still do not have access ..................... . the internet.
He was accused ………………….. theft.
I am not acquainted ...................... him.
He was born ………………… a small village.
We started ………………….. six …………………. the morning.
He hanged himself ...................... a piece of cloth.
That portrait was painted ..................... a famous artist who lived ...................... the nineteenth century.
